intro: Cnemidostachys dubia, commonly known as the slender leaved grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental appeal and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
